fact_check_explanation_title: What do leaked Treasury documents tell us about checks on goods crossing the Irish Sea?
fact_check_explanation_summary: We look at what the leaked Treasury documents Jeremy Corbyn revealed say about checks on goods between Northern Ireland and Great Britain.

fact_check_explanation_title: The BBC Prime Ministerial Debate: fact checked
fact_check_explanation_summary: On Friday night the final televised debate between Jeremy Corbyn and Boris Johnson, the Labour and Conservative candidates to be the next prime minister, took place on the BBC.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Barnett Formula isn’t set out in law
fact_check_explanation_summary: The Barnett Formula didn’t apply when the DUP negotiated £1 billion for Northern Ireland because public spending in England didn’t change.

fact_check_explanation_title: £30,000 would be a high graduate salary for most new teachers in England
fact_check_explanation_summary: A commitment to raise teacher salaries to £30,000 by 2022/23 would likely put new teachers in the top quarter of graduate earners in England.

fact_check_explanation_title: Got a question about the election? Ask Full Fact
fact_check_explanation_summary: Ask us any questions you have about the UK general election, and we'll try and get you the answers you deserve.

fact_check_explanation_title: Sajid Javid claims 50% fall in homelessness under Conservatives—homelessness is up since 2010
fact_check_explanation_summary: Statutory homelessness increased by 39% between 2010 and 2017 (more recent data isn’t comparable). Rough sleeping is also up by 165%.

fact_check_explanation_title: This quote about selling NHS assets does not appear in the leaked UK-US trade documents
fact_check_explanation_summary: A quote about the US having a “right to withdraw all trade, aid and communication” in negotiations about the NHS does not appear in a leaked government document.

fact_check_explanation_title: SNP manifesto claim on living wage is slight underestimate
fact_check_explanation_summary: Around 83% of employee jobs in Scotland receive the real living wage or more, this is higher than any of the UK countries, but it lower than in the South …

fact_check_explanation_title: The housing supply has increased by a million in the past five years
fact_check_explanation_summary: Claims about the increasing number of homes under the Conservatives are correct, but the majority of homes are built by the private sector, not the state.
